official-title.#text: To provide for the conveyance of approximately 80 acres of National Forest System land in the Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest in Utah to Brigham Young University, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives June 17, 2013.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Land conveyance, Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest, Utah

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

shall convey, not later than one year after receiving the request, to Brigham Young University all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the approximately 80-acres of National Forest System land in the Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest in the State of Utah generally depicted as

quote.#tail: and dated June 6, 2013. The conveyance shall be subject to valid existing rights and shall be made by quitclaim deed.

text.#text: On the request of Brigham Young University submitted to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , Brigham Young University shall pay to the Secretary an amount equal to the fair market value of the land, as determined by an appraisal approved by the
and conducted in conformity with the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions and

text.#text: As consideration for the land conveyed under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 206 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:206

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be deposited in the general fund of the Treasury to reduce the Federal deficit.
, Brigham Young University represents that it will—

header.#text: Guaranteed public access to Y mountain trail

text.#text: continue to allow the same reasonable public access to the trailhead and portion of the Y Mountain Trail already owned by Brigham Young University as of the date of the enactment of this Act that Brigham Young University has historically allowed; and

quote.#tail: symbol located on the land described in

text.#text: allow that same reasonable public access to the portion of the Y Mountain Trail and the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be determined by a survey satisfactory to the
. Brigham Young University shall pay the reasonable costs of survey, appraisal, and any administrative analyses required by law.

text.#text: The exact acreage and legal description of the land to be conveyed under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 253 EH: Y Mountain Access Enhancement Act
